gov.usgs.anss.smgetter

Class StrongMotionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.smgetter.StrongMotionBuilder

  • public final class StrongMotionBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will get a list of stations where strong motion processing for PGM should be done. A "earthquake" calls evalQuake and every stations with metadata, and within the distance formula a record in the pgm table is created for the station, and a record in the pgmresult table is created for every channel group that needs to be evaluated. The channel groups are found by the vertical component and wild cards need to be use in the processing to pick up the other three components. Only channels with rates >=20 can be used. 
     Table PGM :
 `station` char(7)          The NNSSSSS for the statoin
 `type` char(2)             A type (not currently used)
 `start` datetime           The estimated arrival time of the p wave
 `channels` char(120)       The list of CCCLL for this station to process (one record in pgmresult for each)
 `duration` double(12,3)    The duration of timeseries to analyze
 `quakeAuthor` char(10)     The author of the quake ID
 `quakeID` char(10)         The quake ID from the quake first causing this request
 `status` enum('open','completed','nodata')  Status of this request
 `pgaestimate` smallint(6)  The estimage of PGA per Atkinson and Boole
 `dist` smallint(6)     The distance of this station from the origin in km
 `mag10` smallint(6)    Magitude * 10 so a 4.5 is stored as 45

 Table PGMRESULT
 `pgmID` int(8) unsigned
 `channel` char(12) default NULL,      the NNSSSSSCCCLL for the channel to process Z is present but all 3 components will be processed
 `pgatimez` datetime NOT NULL           The time of the max PGA for the vertical
 `pgaz` double NOT NULL default '0',    The calculated PGA for the vertical is cm/s/s
 `pgvz` double NOT NULL default '0',    The calculated PGV for the vertical in cm/s
 `pgdz` double NOT NULL default '0',    The calculated PGD for the vertical in cm
 `rsa1z` double NOT NULL default '0',   The first RSA value for the vertical (normally 0.3 sec)
 `rsa2z` double NOT NULL default '0',   The second RSA value for the vertical (normally 0.3 sec)
 `rsa3z` double NOT NULL default '0',   The third RSA value for the vertical (normally 0.3 sec)
 `prsa1` double NOT NULL default '0',   The period of first RSA value for the vertical (normally 0.3 sec)
 `prsa2` double NOT NULL default '0',   The period of second RSA value for the vertical (normally 0.3 sec)
 `prsa3` double NOT NULL default '0',    The period of third RSA value for the vertical (normally 0.3 sec)
 `pgatimen` datetime NOT NULL           The time of the max PGA for the north or 1 component
 `pgan` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `pgvn` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `pgdn` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `rsa1n` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `rsa2n` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `rsa3n` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `pgatimeE` datetime NOT NULL           The time of the max PGA for the east or 2 component
 `pgae` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `pgve` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `pgde` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `rsa1e` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `rsa2e` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `rsa3e` double NOT NULL default '0',
 `nextRun` datetime NOT NULL default   This time is used to control the frequency of processing
    The policy for getting a station is :
    1) If < 110 km (1 deg), always get a SM record
    2) if > 440 km (4 deg), never get a SM record
    3) if >110 and < 440, for all stations at dist=100*Mw-325 away, get a record

    The time area to get is the origin time + first a rri val time from TauP, -60 seconds. All requests are for 3 minutes. The

      boolean evalQuake(java.lang.String net, java.lang.String eventID, java.util.GregorianCalendar origin, double lat, double lng, double depth, double mag, java.lang.String type)
      evaluate a earthquake against the list and create fetches for the criteria Normal critera 1) nothing > 450 km, 2) everything less than 110 km, 3) -325+100*Mw elsewhere for 0.1 g the criteria are 1) nothing > 900 km, 2) everything < 110, 3) -415*190*Mw elsewhere

      • evalQuake

        public boolean evalQuake(java.lang.String net,
                         java.lang.String eventID,
                         java.util.GregorianCalendar origin,
                         double lat,
                         double lng,
                         double depth,
                         double mag,
                         java.lang.String type)
                  throws TauModelException
        evaluate a earthquake against the list and create fetches for the criteria Normal critera 1) nothing > 450 km, 2) everything less than 110 km, 3) -325+100*Mw elsewhere for 0.1 g the criteria are 1) nothing > 900 km, 2) everything < 110, 3) -415*190*Mw elsewhere
        Parameters:
        net - the net id
        eventID - The event ID to associate with this quake
        origin - The origin time of the quake
        lat - Epicentral latitude
        lng - Epicentral longitude
        depth - Depth in km of the quake
        mag - A moment magnitude
        type - The two character type to put on the fetchlist.
        Returns:
        true, if this quake generated any fetches.
        Throws:
        edu.sc.seis.TauP.TauModelException
        TauModelException
